bill_title: prohibit the possession of certain items in an airport.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit the possession of certain items in an airport. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Terms used in this Act mean: (1) "Airport," an airport, with a secured area, that regularly serves an air carrier holding a certificate issued by the United States Secretary of Transportation; (2) "Sterile area," a portion of an airport defined in the airport security program to which access generally is controlled through the screening of persons and property, as specified in 49 CFR 1540.5. Section 2. No person may knowingly possess within any sterile area of an airport any of the following items: (1) Any firearm; (2) Any knife with a blade length in excess of four inches, the blade of which is fixed in an unguarded position by the use of one or two hands; (3) Any box cutter or straight razor; (4) Any metal military practice hand grenade; (5) Any metal replica hand grenade; (6) Any plastic replica hand grenade; (7) Any frame, receiver, barrel, or magazine of a firearm; (8) Any unauthorized tear gas weapon; (9) Any stun gun, as defined in § 22-1-2; (10) Any instrument that expels a metallic projectile such as a BB or pellet, through the force of air pressure, carbon dioxide pressure, or spring action, or any spot marker gun or paint gun; or (11) Any ammunition. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 3. The provisions of this Act do not apply to the following persons: (1) Any duly appointed law enforcement officer, any retired law enforcement officer with authorization to carry a concealed weapon, any full-time paid law enforcement officer of another state or the federal government who is carrying out official duties while in the state, or any person summoned by any of these officers to assist in making arrests or preserving the peace while such person is actually engaged in assisting the officer; or (2) Any person who has authorization to possess a weapon specified in section 2 of this Act, granted in writing by an airport security coordinator who is designated as specified in 49 CFR 1542.3, and who is responsible for the security of the airport.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
